english_translation: Regarding what serves as a sutra (screen/barrier) for the one praying, different narrators report variations: The sutra should be like the length of a toothstick (siwak), above a bite mark and below a handspan. Another version states it should be like the back of a saddle, which is the more well-known version

narrators.name: Ibn Muqatil
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Muqatil (authenticator of the chain)

narrators.name: Said
narrators.full_name: Sa'id ibn Hayan (likely Sa'id ibn Yunus)

narrators.name: Abu Dharr al-Ghifari
narrators.full_name: Jundub ibn Janada Abu Dharr al-Ghifari

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Multiple variant recensions of this hadith are presented with differing transmission terms suggesting different sources

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

potential_issues.issue: Multiple variant recensions with differing transmission terms
potential_issues.impact: First chain uses direct hearing terms (سمع, أخبرنا) while second chain uses both direct terms and 'an (عن), and third uses only 'an. These variations suggest different sources and transmission paths

potential_issues.issue: Ibn Muqatil may not be the original transmitter
potential_issues.impact: The text structure suggests Ibn Muqatil is reporting variant versions rather than being part of the original chain

potential_issues.issue: Hasan al-Basri's reported transmission via direct narration
potential_issues.impact: While Hasan is reliable, the direct narration (حدثنا) term to very early narrators needs verification as Hasan is known to sometimes narrate without complete certainty of direct hearing

IISGrade: Acceptable

english_translation: Information about narrator Abu Qubail: He heard from Abdullah ibn Amr and Uqbah ibn Amir. Al-Layth and Yahya ibn Ayyub al-Masri heard from him. Amr ibn Khalid reported that Dammam ibn Ismail narrated from Abu Qubail saying: When Uthman was killed, I was a boy in Yemen. Yahya ibn Bukair said he died in the year 128 AH. Another narration: Sa'id ibn Talid reported that Dammam narrated from Abu Qubail Huyi ibn Hani

narrators.full_name: Abu Qubail Huyi ibn Hani al-Mua'fari

chainIssues: Ibn Ishaq is known as a mudallis and uses 'an transmission; transmission through Ismail from his father from Ibn Ishaq creates chain of 'an transmissions
